meanings.definition: In a rigid or unbending manner
meanings.sent1: She held onto her beliefs inflexibly, refusing to consider any other viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: The door handle was stuck inflexibly, making it impossible to open.
meanings.sent3: The robot followed its programming inflexibly, even when it meant walking into a wall.
meanings.sent4: His mind was inflexibly set on the idea that he could never be wrong.
meanings.sent5: The tree stood inflexibly against the strong winds, its branches unmoving.

meanings.definition: Not willing to change or compromise
meanings.sent1: The inflexible ruler refused to listen to any suggestions for improvement.
meanings.sent2: Her inflexible attitude caused conflicts with her coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The cat was inflexible about its favorite sleeping spot, even when the sun moved.
meanings.sent4: His inflexible stance on the issue made negotiations difficult.
meanings.sent5: The inflexible schedule left no room for unexpected changes.
